result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca A Teschler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Complete high school education.  Maintain employment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Pay costs of supervision and court obligaitons.  No association or contact, directly or indirectly, with males, B.W. and R.E., currently in life.  Cooperate with psychological evaluation and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  Attend five self-help meetings per week for the first year of probation.  Provide proof of attendance to agent.  Follow through with all conditions to retain custody of children.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

Charges per attached AMENDED criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the co-defendant.  No contact with the victims (person, property, residence or family).  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Rebecca A Teschler in court with attorney Thomas Kurzynski .  Jennifer C Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
The State calls Officer Craig Klepel - DSAT. Direct by the State. Witness identifies Brian Wilson and Rebecca Teschler for the record. The witness identifies Charity Willenburg. Cross xam by Ms. Hall -defense for Brian Wilson. Defense marks Ex #1-RPD call detail report. Defense marks Ex #2-Officer Klepel's report. Defense marks Ex #3-affidavit for search warrant. Cross xam by Ms. Larsen - defense for Charity Willenburg. Cross xam by Mr. Kurzynski - defense for Nancy Ezell and Rebecca Teschler. Redirect by the State. Recross by Ms. Hall-defense for Mr. Wilson. No further questions. The witness is excused and steps down. The defense moves Ex #1-3 into evidence. The State objeccts to Ex #3. The Court allows exhibits 1-3 to be received. The State calls Officer Steve Diener - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by Ms. Hall. Redirect by the State. No further questions. The witness is excused and steps down. The State has no further witnesses. Ms. Hall calls Brian Wilson - DSAT. Direct by Ms. Hall for the defense. Cross xam by the State. No further questions. The witness is excused and steps down. Mr. Kurzynski calls Nancy Ezell - DSAT. Direct by Mr. Kurzynski for the defense. Cross xam by the State. Direct by Ms. Hall - counsel for Mr. Wilson. Recross by the State. No further questions. The witness is excused and steps down. No further witnesses.

Argument by Ms. Hall. Argument by Ms. Larsen. Argument by Mr. Kurzynski. Argument by the State. Rebuttal by Ms. Hall.
Defense asks for deft to be allowed to go to the bank and take care of personal business.

BTC: The Court will take matters under advisement. Bond modification to remove ELM is denied.  Bond may be modified for Mr. Wilson to go to the bank and go to the gas station to get gas in the vehicle. All dates, times and locations to be verified with ZCI.
